page.title: 12DUKINFIELD LIBRARIES-2
page.content: from the first library in Dukinfield. The new library has a stock of 25 356 books(1984/5) and a further 8 996 books at a branch library on Cheetham Hill Road. There are 4743 members of the library at Dukinfield out of a population of (1981 census) 22 504. The facilities at the library, which is served by 3 librarians under Mr Paul Chase from Stalybridge library, include an exhibition area, a coffee lounge, a small reference area, a children's section, large-print books, books for ethnic minorities, pictures, audio and video cassettes for loan as well as fiction and non-fiction for adults. The library is also regularly visited by and serves schools in Dukinfield. It is also the base for the mobile library service throughout Tameside to old folks' centres and the housebound.
